less.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not so much or to a smaller degree
less.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Maybe he would worry less if he understood the situation.
In recent years she has appeared in public less frequently.
Social class matters a lot less than it used to.
Your second point is no less important.
It’s a common problem but this doesn’t make it any the less disturbing.
I know he’s done a dreadful thing, but I don’t love him any the less.
‘Will you please come with me?’ It was less a request than a command.
Tickets were less expensive than I had expected.
less.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a smaller amount or not as much
less.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: People today seem to have less time for each other.
Most of us got £4 an hour, but some received even less.
a distance of less than 100 metres
It costs much less to go by bus.
The map covered less of the area than I’d thought.
Flying is less of a risk than driving.
She knows less than I do about it.
less.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: You use less before an uncountable noun
These light bulbs use less electricity
You use fewer before a plural noun    Although you will hear people say this in everyday spoken English, it is considered to be incorrect
There were fewer cars in those days
There were less cars in those days
less.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: taking away or not including a particular amount
less.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: He gave us our money back, less the $2 service charge.
less.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: not possible to treat or affect in a particular way
less.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: $150 less what you owe in taxes is $102.
